member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.GlobalOptions
member.summary: A class that provides options to configure global settings for our Syncfusion Blazor components.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.GlobalOptions.IgnoreScriptIsolation
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the Syncfusion Blazor scripts are loaded internally using JavaScript Isolation or refer to the required scripts from the application-end for better performance.
member.value: false, if the Blazor scripts are loaded from built-in source using JavaScript Isolation internally. The default value is false.
member.remarks: When the property value is true, the scripts should be referenced externally in the application-end from NuGet or CDN or by generating from CRG.
member.example:
You can add script reference in one of the following ways externally for better performance when IgnoreScriptIsolation is true.
Reference scripts from NuGet To add script reference for all component except PdfViewer and DocumentEditor.
<script src="_content/Syncfusion.Blazor/scripts/syncfusion-blazor.min.js" type="text/javascript"></script>
To add script reference for PdfViewer.
<script src="_content/Syncfusion.Blazor.PdfViewer/scripts/syncfusion-blazor-pdfviewer.min.js" type="text/javascript"></script>
To add script reference for DocumentEditor.
<script src="_content/Syncfusion.Blazor.WordProcessor/scripts/syncfusion-blazor-documenteditor.min.js" type="text/javascript"></script>
Reference scripts from CDN To add script reference for all component except PdfViewer and DocumentEditor.
<script src="https://cdn.syncfusion.com/blazor/19.3.43/syncfusion-blazor.min.js" type="text/javascript"></script>
To add script reference for PdfViewer.
<script src="https://cdn.syncfusion.com/blazor/19.3.43/syncfusion-blazor-pdfviewer.min.js" type="text/javascript"></script>
To add script reference for DocumentEditor.
<script src="https://cdn.syncfusion.com/blazor/19.3.43/syncfusion-blazor-documenteditor.min.js" type="text/javascript"></script>
Note: Ensure to change the version in CDN link based on the syncfusion version you are using.
Reference scripts by generating from Blazor CRG for only used components Generate a required component script and styles from Blazor custom resource generator(Blazor CRG) and refer to them in your application.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.GlobalOptions.EnableRippleEffect
member.summary: Specifies whether the ripple effect is enabled in the application.
member.value: true, if the ripple effect is enabled in the application. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.GlobalOptions.EnableRtl
member.summary: Specifies whether the Rtl mode enabled in the application.
member.value: true, if the Rtl mode enabled in the application. The default value is false.

member.summary: The Button is a graphical user interface element that triggers an event on its click action. It can contain a text, an image, or both.

member.summary: Sets content for button element including HTML and its customizations.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton.Content
member.summary: Defines the text content of the button element and it will support only string type.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton.CssClass
member.summary: Defines class/multiple classes separated by a space in the button element. The Button types, styles, and size can be defined by using this property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton.Disabled
member.summary: Specifies a value that indicates whether the Button is enabled or disabled.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering Button component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton.IconCss
member.summary: Defines class/multiple classes separated by a space for the Button that is used to include an icon. Buttons can also include font icon and sprite image.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton.IconPosition
member.summary: Positions the icon based on the text content in the button and its default value is Left. The possible values are: - Left: The icon will be positioned to the left of the text content. - Right: The icon will be positioned to the right of the text content. - Top: The icon will be positioned to the top of the text content. - Bottom: The icon will be positioned to the bottom of the text content.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton.IsPrimary
member.summary: Allows the appearance of the button to be enhanced and visually appealing when set to true.

member.summary: Denotes the smaller size of icon. The icon size will be `8px`.

member.summary: Denotes the default size of icon. The icon size will be `16px`.

member.summary: Denotes the larger size of icon. The icon size will be `24px`.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfIcon
member.summary: SfIcon component used to render the predefined syncfusion icons using property or custom font icons using property.
member.example:
The below example shows loading syncfusion icon using property.
<SfIcon Name="IconName.Italic" Title="Italic"></SfIcon>
The below example shows loading syncfusion icon using property.
<SfIcon IconCss="e-icons e-bold" Title="Bold"></SfIcon>
The below example shows loading third party icon using component. Plus icon were loaded from open iconic, by defining the open iconic font CSS.
<SfIcon IconCss="oi oi-plus" Title="Plus"></SfIcon>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfIcon.ChildContent
member.summary: Gets or sets the child content for Icon component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfIcon.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: Gets or sets a collection of additional attributes that will be applied to icon element.
member.remarks: Additional attributes can be added by specifying as inline attributes or by specifying @attributes directive.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfIcon.IconCss
member.summary: Gets or sets a CSS class string which can be used to provide custom icon or custom style for icons.
member.value: Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to provide custom icon or custom style for icons. The default value is String.Empty.
member.remarks: IconCss property used to append custom class to the predefined icons. This property will also render the customized icons like font-awesome icons.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfIcon.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the built-in syncfusion icons to render.
member.value: One of the enumeration.
member.remarks: This property is used to render icons from predefined options. You can use to load custom icons.

example.code: <SfIcon Name="IconName.Bold"></SfIcon>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfIcon.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the icon.
member.value: One of the enumeration that specifies the size of the icon. The default value is
member.remarks: The Size property used to set font size for icons. This property will considered only when icons are rendered using property.

example.code: <SfIcon Name="IconName.Paste" Size="IconSize.Large"></SfIcon>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfIcon.Title
member.summary: Gets or sets title attribute for icon.
member.value: Accepts a string. The default value is String.Empty.
member.remarks: Title attribute used to improve accessibility with screen readers and show a tooltip on mouse over the icon.

example.code: <SfIcon Name="IconName.Cut" Title="Cut"></SfIcon>

member.summary: Positions label `before`/`after` the RadioButton. The possible values are: - Before: The label is positioned to left of the RadioButton. - After: The label is positioned to right of the RadioButton.

member.summary: Triggers when Switch state has been changed by user interaction.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Adaptors
member.summary:
Specifies the data adaptors.
BlazorAdaptor Default. BlazorAdaptor is used to process Enumerable data. It contains methods to process the given collection based on the queries.
ODataAdaptor
OData Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from OData services.
ODataV4Adaptor
ODatav4 Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from OData v4 services
WebApiAdaptor
WebApi Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from WebApi services. This adaptor is targeted to interact with Web API created using OData endpoint, it is extended from ODataAdaptor
UrlAdaptor
URL Adaptor is used when you are required to interact with all kind of remote services to retrieve data.
RemoteSaveAdaptor
Remote Save Adaptor is used for binding JSON data. It interacts with remote services only for CRUD operations.
CustomAdaptor
CustomAdaptor specifies that own data query and manipulation logic has been provided using custom adaptor component extended from DataAdaptor class.
JsonAdaptor
JsonAdaptor is used to process JSON data at the client side. It contains methods to process the given JSON data based on the queries.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Adaptors.JsonAdaptor
member.summary: JsonAdaptor is used to process JSON data at the client side. It contains methods to process the given JSON data based on the queries.

member.summary: BlazorAdaptor is used to process Enumerable data. It contains methods to process the given collection based on the queries.

M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Data.QueryableExtensions.Where(System.Linq.IQueryable,System.String,System.Object,Syncfusion.Blazor.Data.FilterType,System.Boolean,System.Type)
M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Data.QueryableExtensions.Where(System.Linq.IQueryable,System.Linq.Expressions.ParameterExpression,System.Linq.Expressions.Expression)
member.summary:
Use this function to generate WHERE expression based on Predicates. The AndPredicate and OrPredicate should be used in combination to build the predicate expression which is finally passed on to this function for creating a Lambda.
DataClasses1DataContext db = new DataClasses1DataContext();.
var orders = db.Orders.Skip(0).Take(100).ToList();.
var queryable = orders.AsQueryable();.
var parameter = queryable.Parameter("ShipCountry");.
var binaryExp = queryable.Predicate(parameter,.
"ShipCountry", "USA", true);.
var filteredOrders = queryable.Where(parameter, binaryExp);.
foreach (var order in filteredOrders).
{.
Console.WriteLine(order);.
}.
Build Predicates for Contains / StartsWith / EndsWith,.
IQueryable queryable = nw.Orders.AsQueryable();.
var parameter = queryable.Parameter();.
var exp1 = queryable.Predicate(parameter, "ShipCountry", "h", FilterType.Contains);.
var exp2 = queryable.Predicate(parameter, "ShipCountry", "a", FilterType.StartsWith);.
var andExp = exp2.OrPredicate(exp1);.
var filters = queryable.Where(parameter, andExp);.
foreach (Orders item in filters).
{.
Console.WriteLine("{0}/{1}", item.OrderID, item.ShipCountry);.
}.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.BaseComponent
member.summary: A Base Component for all the Syncfusion Blazor UI components.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager
member.summary: The DataManager is a data management component used for performing data operations in applications. It acts as an abstraction for using local data source - IEnumerable and remote data source - web services returning JSON or oData.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.HttpClientInstance
member.summary: Specifies the HttpClient instance to be used by DataManager.
member.remarks: Use HttpClientInstance property to inject named HttpClient into DataManager.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.Url
member.summary: Specifies the endpoint URL. DataManager requests this URL when data is needed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.AdaptorInstance
member.summary: Specifies the custom adaptor class type. DataManager uses this type value to instantiate custom adaptor class.
member.remarks: DataManager uses Activator.CreateInstance method to create custom adaptor instance. Injecting services into custom adaptor class, is not supported while using this approach. To inject and use services, provide custom adaptor as a Blazor component by extending DataAdaptor class.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.Adaptor
member.summary:
Gets or sets the data adaptor to be used by DataManager.
BlazorAdaptor Default. BlazorAdaptor is used to process Enumerable data. It contains methods to process the given collection based on the queries.
ODataAdaptor
OData Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from OData services.
ODataV4Adaptor
ODatav4 Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from OData v4 services
WebApiAdaptor
WebApi Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from WebApi services. This adaptor is targeted to interact with Web API created using OData endpoint, it is extended from ODataAdaptor
UrlAdaptor
URL Adaptor is used when you are required to interact with all kind of remote services to retrieve data.
RemoteSaveAdaptor
Remote Save Adaptor is used for binding JSON data. It interacts with remote services only for CRUD operations.
CustomAdaptor
CustomAdaptor specifies that own data query and manipulation logic has been provided using custom adaptor component extended from DataAdaptor class.
JsonAdaptor
JsonAdaptor is used to process JSON data at the client side. It contains methods to process the given JSON data based on the queries.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.DataAdaptor
member.summary: Holds adaptor instance.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.DotNetObjectRef
member.summary: Holds dotnet instance.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.InsertUrl
member.summary: Specifies the insert URL.
member.remarks: Applicable for remote adaptors. When Insert method is called, request will be made to InsertUrl. If InsertUrl is not provided, Url is used as fallback.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.RemoveUrl
member.summary: Specifies the remove URL.
member.remarks: Applicable for remote adaptors. When Remove method is called, request will be made to RemoveUrl. If RemoveUrl is not provided, Url is used as fallback.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.UpdateUrl
member.summary: Specifies the update URL.
member.remarks: Applicable for remote adaptors. When Update method is called, request will be made to UpdateUrl. If UpdateUrl is not provided, Url is used as fallback.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.CrudUrl
member.summary: Specifies the CRUD URL.
member.remarks: Applicable for remote adaptors. When Insert, Remove or Update method is called, request will be made to CrudUrl. If CrudUrl is not provided, Url is used as fallback.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.BatchUrl
member.summary: Specifies the batch url.
member.remarks: Applicable for remote adaptors. When SaveChanges method is called, request will be made to BatchUrl. If BatchUrl is not provided, Url is used as fallback.

member.remarks: Use Headers to add any custom headers to the request made by DataManager. Users can also send authentication bearer token using Headers property.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.PathElement
member.summary: Represents the class which defines how to align the path based on offsetX and offsetY.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Width="1000px" Height="1000px" @bind-Nodes="Nodes" SetNodeTemplate="SetTemplate">
            </SfDiagramComponent>    
            @code
            { 
              DiagramObjectCollection<Node> Nodes = new DiagramObjectCollection<Node>();
              private ICommonElement SetTemplate(IDiagramObject node)
              {
                if ((node as Node).ID == "node2")
                {
                  Canvas container = new Canvas();
                  PathElement diagramElement = new PathElement();
                  diagramElement.Style.Fill = "green";
                  diagramElement.Data = "M150 0 L75 200 L225 200 Z";
                  container.Children.Add(diagramElement);
                  return container;
                }
                return null;
              }
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.TextElement
member.summary: Represents the text element which is used to display text or annotations.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Width = "1000px" Height="1000px" @bind-Nodes="Nodes" SetNodeTemplate="SetTemplate">
            </SfDiagramComponent>    
            @code
            { 
                DiagramObjectCollection<Node> Nodes = new DiagramObjectCollection<Node>();
                private ICommonElement SetTemplate(IDiagramObject node)
                {
                    if ((node as Node).ID == "node2")
                    {
                        Canvas container = new Canvas();
                        TextElement textElement = new TextElement();
                        textElement.Content = "node2content";
                        container.Children.Add(textElement);
                        return container;
                    }
                     return null;
                }
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.PageSettings
member.summary: Specifies how to customize the appearance, width, and height of the diagram page.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent @ref="diagram" Width="100%" Height="500px" Nodes="@nodes" Connectors="@connectors">
                <PageSettings Width = "@PageWidth" Height="@PageHeight" Orientation="@pageOrientation" MultiplePage="@IsMultiplePage" ShowPageBreaks="@IsShowPageBreaks">
                    <PageMargin Left = "@marginLeft" Right="@marginRight" Top="@marginTop" Bottom="@marginBottom"></PageMargin>
                </PageSettings>
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            @code
            {
                SfDiagramComponent diagram;
                double PageWidth = 300;
                double PageHeight = 300;
                PageOrientation pageOrientation = PageOrientation.Landscape;
                bool IsMultiplePage = true;
                bool IsShowPageBreaks = true;
                double marginLeft = 10;
                double marginRight = 10;
                double marginTop = 10;
                double marginBottom = 10;
                DiagramObjectCollection<Node> nodes; DiagramObjectCollection<Connector> connectors;
                protected override void OnInitialized()
                {
                    nodes = new DiagramObjectCollection<Node>()
                    {
                        new Node { ID = "node1", Width = 150, Height = 100, OffsetX = 100, OffsetY = 100, Annotations = new DiagramObjectCollection<ShapeAnnotation>() { new ShapeAnnotation() { Content = "Node1" } } },
                        new Node { ID = "node2", Width = 80, Height = 130, OffsetX = 200, OffsetY = 200, Annotations = new DiagramObjectCollection<ShapeAnnotation>() { new ShapeAnnotation() { Content = "Node2" } } },
                        new Node { ID = "node3", Width = 100, Height = 75, OffsetX = 300, OffsetY = 350, Annotations = new DiagramObjectCollection<ShapeAnnotation>() { new ShapeAnnotation() { Content = "Node3" } } }
                    };
                    connectors = new DiagramObjectCollection<Connector> 
                    {
                        new Connector { ID="connector1", SourcePoint=new DiagramPoint { X=300, Y=400}, TargetPoint = new DiagramPoint { X = 500, Y = 500 } }
                    };
                }
            }

member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the diagram page.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.PageSettings.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the orientation of the page in the diagram. By default, the orientation of the page is set to landscape.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.PageSettings.BoundaryConstraints
member.summary: Allows the user to customize the interactive region.
member.remarks: The boundary constraints property restricts or customizes the interactive region, out of which the elements cannot be dragged, resized or rotated.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.PageSettings.MultiplePage
member.summary: Allows users to enable or disable multiple pages.
member.remarks: When multiple pages are enabled, the size of the page dynamically increases or decreases to split the single page into multiple pages and completely fit the diagram within the page boundaries.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.PageSettings.ShowPageBreaks
member.summary: Allows the user to enable or disable the page break lines.
member.remarks: The ShowPageBreaks property is used as a visual guide to see how pages are split into multiple pages. By default, it is false. If it is true, then the page break lines will be visible.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.PageSettings.Margin
member.summary: Specifies the extra space around the diagram content. The default values for the margin are set to 25 on all sides.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.PageSettings.Background
member.summary: Defines the page background.
member.remarks: Users can customize the background of the diagram page by using the background property. The Source property of background allows the user to set the path of the image to the background, whereas the Color property of the background allows the user to set a color to the background of the diagram page. By default, it is set to transparent.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.ScrollSettings
member.summary: Sets the diagram's current zoom value, zoom factor, scroll state, and viewport size.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Width="1000px" Height="1000px">
                <ScrollSettings @bind-VerticalOffset="@verticalOffset" @bind-HorizontalOffset="@horizontalOffset" @bind-ScrollLimit="@scrollLimit" @bind-CurrentZoom="@currentZoom" @bind-MinZoom="minZoom" @bind-MaxZoom="@maxZoom">
                </ScrollSettings>
            </SfDiagramComponent>    
            @code
            {
                double verticalOffset { get; set; } = 300;
                double horizontalOffset { get; set; } = -1000;
                ScrollLimitMode scrollLimit { get; set; } = ScrollLimitMode.Infinity;
                double currentZoom { get; set; } = 1;
                double minZoom { get; set; } = 0.2;
                double maxZoom { get; set; } = 1.5;
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.GridLines
member.summary: Represents the visual guidance while dragging or arranging the objects.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Width = "1000px" Height="500px">
                <SnapSettings Constraints="SnapConstraints.ShowLines">
                    <HorizontalGridLines LineColor="blue" LineDashArray="2,2" LineIntervals="@LineInterval">
                    </HorizontalGridLines>
                    <VerticalGridLines LineColor="blue" LineDashArray="2,2" LineIntervals="@LineInterval">
                    </VerticalGridLines>
                </SnapSettings>
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            @code
            {
               //Set the line intervals for the gridlines
               public double[] LineInterval { get; set; } = new double[] 
               {
                    1.25, 14, 0.25, 15, 0.25, 15, 0.25, 15, 0.25, 15
               };
            }

example.code: <SfDiagramComponent Height="500px"> // Shows the horizontal gridlines <SnapSettings Constraints ="SnapConstraints.ShowLines" SnapAngle="10"> <HorizontalGridLines LineColor = "blue" LineDashArray="2,2"> </HorizontalGridLines> <VerticalGridLines LineColor = "blue" LineDashArray="2,2"> </VerticalGridLines> </SnapSettings> </SfDiagramComponent>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.SnapSettings.ChildContent
member.summary: Gets or sets the child content of the SnapSettings.

member.summary: Defines the pattern of vertical gridlines.

member.summary: Defines the pattern of horizontal gridlines

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.SnapSettings.Constraints
member.summary: Enables or disables the features of gridlines and SnapSettings.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.SnapSettings.ConstraintsChanged
member.summary: Specifies the callback to trigger when the constraints changes.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.SnapSettings.SnapDistance
member.summary: Defines the minimum distance between the selected object and the nearest object. By default, it is 5.

example.code: <SfDiagramComponent> <SnapSettings SnapDistance="10"> </SnapSettings> </SfDiagramComponent>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.SnapSettings.SnapDistanceChanged
member.summary: Specifies the callback to trigger when the SnapObjectDistance changes.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.SnapSettings.SnapAngle
member.summary: SnapAngle defines the angle by which the object needs to be rotated. By default, 5.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.SnapSettings.SnapAngleChanged
member.summary: Specifies the callback to trigger when the SnaAngle changes.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.SnapSettings.GridType
member.summary: Defines the diagram Grid pattern.
member.remarks: The GridType can be set to lines or dots. By default, the GridType is set to lines.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.SnapSettings.GridTypeChanged
member.summary: Specifies the callback to trigger when the GridType changes.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.VerticalGridLines
member.summary: Represents the vertical gridlines of the diagram.
member.remarks: VerticalGridlines provides the visual guidance while dragging or arranging the objects on the diagram surface.

example.code: <SfDiagramComponent Height="600px"> @* Shows vertical gridlines *@ <SnapSettings Constraints = "SnapConstraints.ShowLines" > @* Customizes the line color and line style to the gridlines*@ <VerticalGridLines LineColor = "blue" LineDashArray="2,2" /> </SnapSettings> </SfDiagramComponent>

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.HorizontalAlignment
member.summary: Represents the alignment of the diagram elements based on its immediate parent.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Height="600px" Nodes="@nodes">
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            @code
            {
                public DiagramObjectCollection<Node> nodes = new DiagramObjectCollection<Node>() { };
                protected override void OnInitialized()
                {
                    // A node is created and stored in nodes array.
                    Node Node = new Node()
                    {
                        /// Initialize the port collection
                        Ports = new DiagramObjectCollection<PointPort>()
                        {
                            new PointPort()
                            {
                                HorizontalAlignment = HorizontalAlignment.Left
                            }
                        },
                    };
                    nodes.Add(Node);
                }
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.GridType
member.summary: Specifies the type of gridlines.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Width = "1000px" Height="500px">
                <SnapSettings GridType = "GridType.Dots" >
                    <HorizontalGridLines LineColor="Blue" @bind-LineIntervals="@HInterval"
                                      @bind-DotIntervals="@HDotInterval"></HorizontalGridLines>
                    <VerticalGridLines LineColor = "Blue" @bind-LineIntervals="@VInterval"
                                     @bind-DotIntervals="@VDotInterval"></VerticalGridLines>
                </SnapSettings>
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            @code
            {
               public double[] HDotInterval { get; set; } = new double[] { 3, 20, 1, 20, 1, 20 };
               public double[] VDotInterval { get; set; } = new double[] { 3, 20, 1, 20, 1, 20, 1, 20, 1, 20 };
               public double[] HInterval { get; set; } = new double[] { 1.25, 18.75, 0.25, 19.75, 0.25, 19.75, 0.25, 19.75, 0.25, 19.75 };
               public double[] VInterval { get; set; } = new double[] { 1.25, 18.75, 0.25, 19.75, 0.25, 19.75, 0.25, 19.75, 0.25, 19.75 };
            }

member.summary: Renders grid patterns as dots.

member.summary: Wraps the text to the next line, when it exceeds its bounds.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.TextWrap.WrapWithOverflow
member.summary: Text-wrapping occurs when the text overflows beyond the available node width. However, the text may overflow beyond the node width in case of a very long word.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.TextWrap.Wrap
member.summary: The text will be wrapped within the boundary.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.TextWrap.NoWrap
member.summary: The text will not be wrapped. If a lengthy text exists, the boundary will not be a limit.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.PortShapes
member.summary: Specifies the shape of the ports.
member.remarks: To know more about using port shapes, refer to the Ports. To apply the X port shape, use the below code

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Height="600px" Nodes="@nodes">
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            @code{
              DiagramObjectCollection<Node> nodes;
              protected override void OnInitialized()
              {
                //Initialize the NodeCollection.
                nodes = new DiagramObjectCollection<Node>();
                Node Node = new Node()
                {
                  ID = "node1",
                  Height = 100,
                  Width = 100,
                  OffsetX = 100,
                  OffsetY = 100,
                };
                Node.Ports = new DiagramObjectCollection<PointPort>()
                {
                 new PointPort()
                 {
                     ID="port1",
                     Offset=new DiagramPoint(){X=0,Y=0.5},
                     Shape=PortShapes.X,
                     Visibility=PortVisibility.Hover|PortVisibility.Connect,
                     //set the PortConstraints...
                     Constraints=PortConstraints.Draw
                  }
                };
                nodes.Add(Node);
               }
            }

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.PortShapes.X
member.summary: Sets the shape of the port to X.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.PortShapes.Circle
member.summary: Sets the shape of the port to Circle.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.PortShapes.Square
member.summary: Sets the shape of the port to Square.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.PortShapes.Custom
member.summary: Sets the shape of the port to Custom.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.PortVisibility
member.summary: Represents the visibility options of the port.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Height="600px" Nodes="@nodes">
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            @code 
            {
              DiagramObjectCollection<Node> nodes;
              protected override void OnInitialized()
              {
               //Initialize the NodeCollection.
               nodes = new DiagramObjectCollection<Node>();
               Node Node = new Node()
               {
                 ID = "node1",
                 Height = 100,
                 Width = 100,
                 OffsetX = 100,
                 OffsetY = 100,
               };
               Node.Ports = new DiagramObjectCollection<PointPort>()
               {
                 new PointPort()
                 {
                   ID="port1",
                   Offset=new DiagramPoint(){X=0,Y=0.5},
                   Shape=PortShapes.X,
                   Visibility=PortVisibility.Hover|PortVisibility.Connect,
                   //set the PortConstraints...
                   Constraints=PortConstraints.Draw
                  }
                };
                nodes.Add(Node);
               }
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.FlowShapeType
member.summary: Specifies the type of process flow shape.
member.remarks: To learn more about using flow shapes, refer Shapes.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Height="600px" Nodes="@nodes" />
             @code
             {
                //Initialize the node collection with node
                DiagramObjectCollection<Node> nodes = new DiagramObjectCollection<Node>();
                protected override void OnInitialized()
                {
                    Node node = new Node()
                    {
                        ID = "node1",
                        //Size of the node
                        Height = 100,
                        Width = 100,
                        //Position of the node
                        OffsetX = 100,
                        OffsetY = 100,
                        //Set the type of shape as flow
                        Shape = new FlowShape()
                        {
                            Type = Shapes.Flow,
                            Shape = FlowShapesType.DirectData
                        }
                    };
                    nodes.Add(node);
                }
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.DecoratorShape
member.summary: Specifies the decorator shape of the connector.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Width="1000px" Height="500px" Connectors="@connectors">
                <SnapSettings Constraints = "@snapConstraints" ></SnapSettings>
            </SfDiagramComponent >
            @code
            {
                SnapConstraints snapConstraints = SnapConstraints.None;
                //Define the diagram's connector collection
                DiagramObjectCollection<Connector> connectors = new DiagramObjectCollection<Connector>();
                protected override void OnInitialized()
                {
                    Connector Connector = new Connector()
                    {
                        ID = "connector1",
                        // Set the source and target point of the connector
                        SourcePoint = new DiagramPoint() { X = 100, Y = 100 },
                        TargetPoint = new DiagramPoint() { X = 200, Y = 200 },
                        // Type of the connector segment
                        Type = ConnectorSegmentType.Straight,
                        TargetDecorator = new DecoratorSettings()
                        {
                            Shape = DecoratorShape.Arrow,
                            Style = new ShapeStyle()
                            {
                                Fill = "#6f409f",
                                StrokeColor = "#6f409f",
                                StrokeWidth = 1
                            }
                        }
                    };
                    connectors.Add(Connector);
                }
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Direction
member.summary: Specifies the orthogonal connector's connection segment direction.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Width="1000px" Height="1000px"  @bind-Connectors="@connectors">
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            @code
            {
                public DiagramObjectCollection<Connector> connectors = new DiagramObjectCollection<Connector>();    
                Connector connector = new Connector()
                {
                    ID = "connector",
                    SourceID = "node13",
                    TargetID = "node14",
                    Type = ConnectorSegmentType.Orthogonal,
                    Segments = new DiagramObjectCollection<ConnectorSegment>() 
                    { 
                        new OrthogonalSegment() 
                        { 
                            Length = 70, 
                            Type = ConnectorSegmentType.Orthogonal, 
                            Direction = Direction.Right 
                        }, 
                        new OrthogonalSegment() 
                        { 
                            Length = 20, 
                            Type = ConnectorSegmentType.Orthogonal, 
                            Direction = Direction.Bottom 
                        } 
                    }
                };
                connectors.Add(connector);
            }

example.code:

            <BackgroundStyle ImageSource = "@imageSource" ImageScale="@imageScale></BackgroundStyle>
            </SfDiagramComponent>

            Scale imageScale = Scale.Slice;

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Scale.None
member.summary: There will be no scaling of the image.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Scale.Meet
member.summary: stretches the content in both the x and y dimensions until it fills the width or height provided.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Scale.Slice
member.summary: Preserves the aspect ratio of the content but scales up the graphic until it fills both the width and height provided (clipping the content that overflows the bounds).

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Stretch.Slice

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.SubTreeAlignmentType
member.summary: Specifies the collection of sub tree alignments in an organizational chart.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Height = "600px" NodeCreating="@NodeDefaults" ConnectorCreating="@ConnectorDefaults">
                <DataSourceSettings ID = "Id" ParentID="Team" DataSource="@DataSource"></DataSourceSettings>   
                <Layout Type = "LayoutType.OrganizationalChart"
                        @bind-HorizontalSpacing="@HorizontalSpacing" 
                        @bind-VerticalSpacing="@VerticalSpacing" 
                        GetLayoutInfo="GetLayoutInfo">
                </Layout>
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            @code
            {
               int HorizontalSpacing = 40;
               int VerticalSpacing = 50;
               private TreeInfo GetLayoutInfo(IDiagramObject obj, TreeInfo options)
               {
                    options.AlignmentType = SubTreeAlignmentType.Alternate;
                    options.Orientation = Orientation.Vertical;
                    return options;         
               }
               private void ConnectorDefaults(IDiagramObject connector)
               {
                   (connector as Connector).Type = ConnectorSegmentType.Orthogonal;
                   (connector as Connector).TargetDecorator.Shape = DecoratorShape.None;
                   (connector as Connector).Style = new ShapeStyle() { StrokeColor = "#6d6d6d" };
                   (connector as Connector).Constraints = 0;
                   (connector as Connector).CornerRadius = 5;
               }
               private void NodeDefaults(IDiagramObject obj)
               {
                   Node node = obj as Node;
                   node.Height = 50;
                   node.Width = 150;
                   node.Style = new ShapeStyle() { Fill = "#6495ED", StrokeWidth = 1, StrokeColor = "Black" };
               }
               public class OrgChartDataModel 
               {
                   public string Id  { get; set; }
                   public string Team { get; set; }
                   public string Role { get; set; }
               }
               public object DataSource = new List<object>()
               {
                   new OrgChartDataModel() { Id= "1", Role= "General Manager" },
                   new OrgChartDataModel() { Id= "2", Role= "Human Resource Manager", Team= "1" },
                   new OrgChartDataModel() { Id= "3", Role= "Design Manager", Team= "1" },
                   new OrgChartDataModel() { Id= "4", Role= "Operation Manager", Team= "1" },
                   new OrgChartDataModel() { Id= "5", Role= "Marketing Manager", Team= "1" }
               };
            }

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.SubTreeAlignmentType.Left
member.summary: Aligns the child nodes at the left of the parent in a horizontal/vertical sub tree.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.SubTreeAlignmentType.Right
member.summary: Aligns the child nodes at the right of the parent in a horizontal/vertical sub tree.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.SubTreeAlignmentType.Center
member.summary: Aligns the child nodes at the center of the parent in a horizontal sub tree.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.SubTreeAlignmentType.Alternate
member.summary: Aligns the child nodes alternatively on both left and right sides in a vertical sub tree.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.SubTreeAlignmentType.Balanced
member.summary: Aligns the child nodes horizontally to balance the width and height of the sub tree.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.LayoutOrientation
member.summary: Specifies the orientation of the automatic layout.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent @ref="@Diagram" Height="499px" InteractionController="@InteractionController.ZoomPan" ConnectorCreating="@ConnectorDefaults" NodeCreating="@NodeDefaults">
                <DataSourceSettings ID = "Name" ParentID="Category" DataSource="DataSource"> </DataSourceSettings>
                    <Layout @bind-Type="type" @bind-HorizontalSpacing="@HorizontalSpacing" @bind-Orientation="@orientation" @bind-VerticalSpacing="@VerticalSpacing" @bind-HorizontalAlignment="@horizontalAlignment" @bind-VerticalAlignment="@verticalAlignment" GetLayoutInfo="GetLayoutInfo">                
                    </Layout>            
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            @code
            {
               SfDiagramComponent Diagram;
               public int? HValue { get; set; } = 30;
               public int? VValue { get; set; } = 30;
               LayoutType type = LayoutType.HierarchicalTree;
               LayoutOrientation orientation = LayoutOrientation.TopToBottom;
               HorizontalAlignment horizontalAlignment = HorizontalAlignment.Auto;
               VerticalAlignment verticalAlignment = VerticalAlignment.Auto;
               int HorizontalSpacing = 30;
               int VerticalSpacing = 30;
               private void ConnectorDefaults(IDiagramObject connector)
               {
                   (connector as Connector).Type = ConnectorSegmentType.Orthogonal;
                   (connector as Connector).TargetDecorator.Shape = DecoratorShape.None;
                   (connector as Connector).Style = new ShapeStyle() { StrokeColor = "#6d6d6d" };
                   (connector as Connector).Constraints = 0;
                   (connector as Connector).CornerRadius = 5;
               }
               private TreeInfo GetLayoutInfo(IDiagramObject obj, TreeInfo options)
               {
                   options.EnableSubTree = true;
                   options.Orientation = Orientation.Horizontal;
                   return options;
               }
               private void NodeDefaults(IDiagramObject obj)
               {
                   Node node = obj as Node;
                   if (node.Data is System.Text.Json.JsonElement)
                   {
                       node.Data = System.Text.Json.JsonSerializer.Deserialize<HierarchicalDetails>(node.Data.ToString());
                   }
                   HierarchicalDetails hierarchicalData = node.Data as HierarchicalDetails;
                   node.Style = new ShapeStyle() { Fill = "#659be5", StrokeColor = "none", StrokeWidth = 2, };
                   node.BackgroundColor = "#659be5";
                   node.Width = 150;
                   node.Height = 50;
                   node.Annotations = new DiagramObjectCollection<ShapeAnnotation>()
                   {
                       new ShapeAnnotation()
                       {
                           Content = hierarchicalData.Name,
                           Style =new TextStyle(){Color = "white"}
                       }
                   };
               }
               public class HierarchicalDetails 
               {
                   public string Name { get; set; }
                   public string FillColor { get; set; }
                   public string Category { get; set; }
               }
               public List<HierarchicalDetails> DataSource = new List<HierarchicalDetails>()
               {
                   new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Diagram", Category="",FillColor="#659be5"},
                   new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Layout", Category="Diagram",FillColor="#659be5"},
                   new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Tree layout", Category="Layout",FillColor="#659be5"},
                   new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Organizational chart", Category="Layout",FillColor="#659be5"},
                   new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Hierarchical tree", Category="Tree layout",FillColor="#659be5"},
                   new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Radial tree", Category="Tree layout",FillColor="#659be5"},
                   new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Mind map", Category="Hierarchical tree",FillColor="#659be5"},
               };
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.InteractionController
member.summary: Allows the users to customize the selection, zooming, and interaction behavior of the diagram.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent @ref="@diagram" Width="1000px"  Height="1000px" InteractionController="Tools" DrawingObject="@DrawingObject" Nodes="@nodes">
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            @code
            {
               SfDiagramComponent diagram;
               InteractionController Tools = InteractionController.ContinuousDraw;
               IDiagramObject DrawingObject { get; set; }
               DiagramObjectCollection<Node> nodes = new DiagramObjectCollection<Node>();
               protected override void OnInitialized()
               {
                   Node node = new Node()
                   {
                       Shape = new FlowShape() { Type = Shapes.Flow, Shape = FlowShapeType.Decision }
                   };
                   DrawingObject = node;
               }
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.CollectionChangedAction
member.summary: Specifies whether an object is added/removed from the diagram.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Width = "1000px" Height="1000px" SelectionChanging="@OnSelectionChanging">
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            @code
            {
                private void OnSelectionChanging(SelectionChangingEventArgs args)
                {
                    if ((args != null) && (args.NewValue != null) && (args.OldValue != null))
                    {
                        CollectionChangedAction type = args.Type;
                    }
                }
            }

member.summary: Represents the final step of the process.

member.summary: Represents the continuing once along with the trigger type.

member.summary: Sets the type of the task to None.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.BpmnTriggers.Message
member.summary: Represents the process is started, it is facilitated, or it is completed.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.BpmnTriggers.Timer
member.summary: Represents the time and date that triggers the process.

member.summary: Represents when an escalation occurs, a step is triggered and passed to another position within the organization.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.BpmnTriggers.Link
member.summary: Represents a sub-process that is a component of a bigger process.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.BpmnTriggers.Error
member.summary: Represents an error trigger that will always interrupt the process that is contained in it.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.BpmnTriggers.Compensation
member.summary: Represents a refund that occurs when procedures are partially successful.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.BpmnTriggers.Signal
member.summary: Represents a signal that is shared by several processes.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.BpmnTriggers.Multiple
member.summary: Represents a process that is started by several triggers.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.BpmnTriggers.Parallel
member.summary: Represents an instance of a process that does not begin, continue, or finish until all the potential events have occurred.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.BpmnTriggers.Cancel
member.summary: Represents the cancelling of process.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.BpmnTriggers.Conditional
member.summary: Represents a process that begins or continues when a business condition or business rule is met.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.BpmnTriggers.Terminate
member.summary: Represents a process step to be immediately terminated.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.BpmnGateways.Inclusive
member.summary: It breaks the process flow into one or more flows.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.BpmnGateways.Parallel

member.summary: It is used for the most complex flows in the business process.

member.summary: It is similar to an exclusive gateway because both involve one path in the flow.

member.summary: Represents the input for the entire process in the diagram.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.BpmnDataObjects.Output

member.summary: Defines the work that a company or organization performs in a business process using nodes in the diagram.

member.summary: Represents the activity within a process flow. we can create a task when the activity cannot be broken down to a finer level of detail.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.BpmnActivities.SubProcess

member.summary: Represents the task that repeats over and over again in sequence.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.BpmnLoops.ParallelMultiInstance

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.BpmnLoops.SequenceMultiInstance

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.BpmnTasks.Send

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.ModifierKeys
member.summary: Specifies a combination of key modifiers, on recognition of which the command will be executed.

example.code:
<summary>
            Notifies when to execute the custom keyboard commands .
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            The following code illustrates how to create a custom command.
            </remarks>
            <example>
            <code lang="Razor">
            <![CDATA[
            <SfDiagramComponent @ref="@diagram" Height="600px" Nodes="@nodes">
            @* Initializing the custom commands*@
                <CommandManager Commands = "@command" Execute="@CommandExecute" CanExecute="@canexe">
                </CommandManager>
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            @code
            {
                // Reference to the diagram
                SfDiagramComponent diagram;
                DiagramObjectCollection<KeyboardCommand> command = new DiagramObjectCollection<KeyboardCommand>()
                {
                    new KeyboardCommand()
                    {
                        Name = "CustomGroup",
                        Gesture = new KeyGesture() { Key = Keys.G, Modifiers = ModifierKeys.Control }
                    },
                    new KeyboardCommand()
                    {
                        Name = "CustomUnGroup",
                        Gesture = new KeyGesture() { Key = Keys.U, Modifiers = ModifierKeys.Control }
                    },
                };
                // Define the diagram's nodes collection
                DiagramObjectCollection<Node> nodes = new DiagramObjectCollection<Node>();
                public void canexe(CommandKeyArgs args)
                {
                    args.CanExecute = true;
                }
                public void CommandExecute(CommandKeyArgs args)
                {
                    if (args.Gesture.Modifiers == ModifierKeys.Control && args.Gesture.Key == Keys.G)
                    {
                        //Custom command to group the selected nodes
                        diagram.Group();
                    }
                    if (args.Gesture.Modifiers == ModifierKeys.Control && args.Gesture.Key == Keys.U)
                    {
                        DiagramSelectionSettings selector = diagram.SelectionSettings;
                        //Custom command to ungroup the selected items
                        if (selector.Nodes.Count > 0 && selector.Nodes[0] is NodeGroup)
                        {
                            if ((selector.Nodes[0] as NodeGroup).Children.Length > 0)
                            {
                                diagram.UnGroup();
                            }
                        }
                    }
                }
            }

            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.PropertyChangedEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the PropertyChanged event.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Width="1000px" Height="1000px" Nodes="@nodes" Connectors="@connectors" PropertyChanged="@PropertyChanged">
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            @code
            { 
              private void PropertyChanged(PropertyChangedEventArgs args)
              {
                if ((args != null) && (args.Element != null) && (args.NewValue != null) && (args.OldValue != null))
                {
                  Console.WriteLine("Changed");
                }
               }
            }

            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.DragStartEventArgs
member.summary: Notifies when the element enters into the diagram from the symbol palette.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Width="1000px" Height="1000px" DragStart="DragStart">
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            private void DragStart(DragStartEventArgs args)
            {
                if (args.Element is Node)
                {
                    (args.Element as Node).Width = 300;
                    (args.Element as Node).Height = 300;
                }
            }

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Width="1000px" Height="1000px" DragDrop="DragDrop">

            private void DragDrop(DropEventArgs args)
            {

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.SizeChangingEventArgs
member.summary: Notifies when the element is resizing.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Height="600px" Nodes="@nodes" SizeChanging="@OnSizeChange" />
            @code
            {
                // To define the node collection
                DiagramObjectCollection<Node> nodes;
                protected override void OnInitialized()
                {
                    nodes = new DiagramObjectCollection<Node>();
                    // A node is created and stored in the nodes collection.
                    Node node = new Node()
                    {
                        // Position of the node
                        OffsetX = 250,
                        OffsetY = 250,
                        // Size of the node
                        Width = 100,
                        Height = 100,
                        Style = new ShapeStyle() { Fill = "#6BA5D7", StrokeColor = "white" }
                    };
                    // Add a node
                    nodes.Add(node);
                }
                // Size change event for the diagram
                public void OnSizeChange(SizeChangingEventArgs args)
                {
                    Console.WriteLine(args.NewValue.Nodes[0].ID);
                }
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.CommandKeyArgs
member.summary: Notifies when to execute the custom keyboard commands .
member.remarks: The following code illustrates how to create a custom command.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent @ref="@diagram" Height="600px" Nodes="@nodes">
            @* Initializing the custom commands*@ 
                <CommandManager Commands = "@command" Execute="@CommandExecute" CanExecute="@canexe">
                </CommandManager>
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            @code
            { 
                // Reference to the diagram
                SfDiagramComponent diagram;
                DiagramObjectCollection<KeyboardCommand> command = new DiagramObjectCollection<KeyboardCommand>()
                {
                    new KeyboardCommand()
                    {
                        Name = "CustomGroup",
                        Gesture = new KeyGesture() { Key = Keys.G, Modifiers = ModifierKeys.Control }
                    },
                    new KeyboardCommand()
                    {
                        Name = "CustomUnGroup",
                        Gesture = new KeyGesture() { Key = Keys.U, Modifiers = ModifierKeys.Control }
                    },
                };
                // Define the diagram's nodes collection
                DiagramObjectCollection<Node> nodes = new DiagramObjectCollection<Node>();
                public void canexe(CommandKeyArgs args)
                {
                    args.CanExecute = true;
                }
                public void CommandExecute(CommandKeyArgs args)
                {
                    if (args.Gesture.Modifiers == ModifierKeys.Control && args.Gesture.Key == Keys.G)
                    {
                        //Custom command to group the selected nodes
                        diagram.Group();
                    }
                    if (args.Gesture.Modifiers == ModifierKeys.Control && args.Gesture.Key == Keys.U)
                    {
                        DiagramSelectionSettings selector = diagram.SelectionSettings;
                        //Custom command to ungroup the selected items
                        if (selector.Nodes.Count > 0 && selector.Nodes[0] is NodeGroup)
                        {
                            if ((selector.Nodes[0] as NodeGroup).Children.Length > 0)
                            {
                                diagram.UnGroup();
                            }
                        }
                    }
                }
            }

member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the connector fixed user handle. By default, it is 0.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.ConnectorFixedUserHandle.Alignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the alignment of the fixed user handle. By default, it is aligned at the center.
member.remarks:
The below list explains the alignment options.
1. Center, aligns the fixedUserHandle on the connector segment.
2. Before, aligns the fixedUserHandle on top of a connector segment.
3. After, aligns the fixedUserHandle at the bottom of a connector segment.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.DiagramHistoryManager.CanUndo
member.summary: Decides whether the history entry can be undo.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.DiagramHistoryManager.CanRedo
member.summary: Decides whether the history entry can be redo.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.DiagramHistoryManager.CurrentEntry
member.summary: Specifies the current entry object.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.DiagramHistoryManager.Push(Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.HistoryEntryBase)
member.summary: Stores a history entry on the history list.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.DiagramHistoryManager.Undo
member.summary: The method will be called when the custom entry is in undo stage.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Width="800px" Height="800px">
                 <DiagramHistoryManager Undo="onCustomUndo"></DiagramHistoryManager>
             </SfDiagramComponent >
             @code
             {
                 private void onCustomUndo(HistoryEntryBase entry)
                 {
                     (entry.RedoObject) = entry.UndoObject.Clone() as Node;
                     (entry.UndoObject as Node).AdditionalInfo[(entry.UndoObject as Node).ID] = "Start";
                 }
             }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.DiagramHistoryManager.Redo
member.summary: The method will be called when the custom entry is in the redo stage.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Width="800px" Height="800px">
                <DiagramHistoryManager Redo="onCustomRedo"></DiagramHistoryManager>
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            @code
            {
                private void onCustomRedo(HistoryEntryBase entry)
                {
                    Node current = entry.UndoObject.Clone() as Node;
                    (entry.UndoObject as Node).AdditionalInfo[(entry.UndoObject as Node).ID] = "Description";
                    entry.RedoObject = current;
                }
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.DiagramHistoryManager.StartGroupAction
member.summary: History allows you to revert or restore multiple changes through a single undo/redo command. It is used to start the grouping of changes.

example.code: //Start the grouping of changes diagram.StartGroupAction();

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.DiagramHistoryManager.EndGroupAction
member.summary: Used to intimate the group action is end

example.code: //End the grouping of changes diagram.EndGroupAction();

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.DiagramHistoryManager.HistoryAdding
member.summary: Decides whether the changes are stored in the history or not.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Width="800px" Height="800px">
                 <DiagramHistoryManager HistoryAdding="OnHistoryAdding"></DiagramHistoryManager>
             </SfDiagramComponent>
             @code
             {
                 private void OnHistoryAdding(HistoryAddingEventArgs args)
                 {
                     args.Cancel = true;
                 }
             }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.NodeBase.ID
member.summary: Gets or sets the unique id of the diagram object.

tr.td: 1. ID needs to be unique to use. While creating a node, the user should not provide the same id to other nodes.
2. When drag and drop a new node from symbolpalette, ID will be generated automatically.
3. If multiple nodes having same ID, then unexpected behaviour might happen.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.NodeBase.Margin
member.summary: The margin adds extra space around an element's outside boundaries. The default values for the margin are 0 from all the sides.

tr.td: Left , represents the value of the left margin.
Top , represents the top margin of the node.
Right , represents the right margin of the node.
Bottom , represents the bottom margin of the node.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.ConnectorSegment
member.summary: Represents the segment of the connector.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Connectors="@connectors">
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            @code
            {
              public DiagramObjectCollection<Connector> connectors = new DiagramObjectCollection<Connector>();
              protected override void OnInitialized()
              {
                Connector connector = new Connector()
                {
                   ID="straight",
                   SourcePoint = new DiagramPoint() { X = 100, Y = 200 },
                   TargetPoint = new DiagramPoint() { X = 300, Y = 200 },
                   Segments = new DiagramObjectCollection<ConnectorSegment>()
                   {
                       //Create a new straight segment 
                       new StraightSegment(){Point=new DiagramPoint(420,300)},
                    }
                };
               connectors.Add(connector);
              }
             }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.DataSourceSettings
member.summary: DataSourceSettings is used to specify the data source and defines how the parent and child relationship will be generated in the layout. It is applicable only when the layout is used.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Width = "1000px" Height="1000px">
            <DataSourceSettings @bind-DataSource="@data" ID="@Id" ParentID="@ParentId" SymbolMapping="@doBinding"></DataSourceSettings>
            <Layout Type = "LayoutType" >
            </ Layout >
            </ SfDiagramComponent >
            @code {
            public object data { get; set; }
            public string Id;
            public string ParentId;
            public LayoutType LayoutType = LayoutType.HierarchicalTree;
            protected override void OnInitialized()
            {
             Id = "Name";
             ParentId = "Category";
             data = Data1;
            }
            //bind the external data with the node
            private Node doBinding(Node node, object data)
            {
             HierarchicalDetails hierarchicalData = data as HierarchicalDetails;
             node.Annotations = new DiagramObjectCollection<ShapeAnnotation>()
            {
             new ShapeAnnotation()
            {
             ID = "annotation"+node.ID,
             Content = hierarchicalData.Name,
            },
            };
            return node;
            }
            public List<HierarchicalDetails> Data1 = new List<HierarchicalDetails>()
            {
             new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Diagram",FillColor="#916DAF"},
             new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Layout", Category="Diagram"},
             new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Tree Layout",Category="Layout"},
             new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Organizational Chart", Category="Layout"}
            };
            public class HierarchicalDetails
            {
             public string Name { get; set; }
             public string Category { get; set; }
             public string FillColor { get; set; }
            }
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.CommandManager
member.summary: Defines the collection of commands and the corresponding key gestures. It is responsible for managing routed commands.
member.remarks: CommandManager provides the support to define custom commands. The custom commands are executed when the specified key gesture is recognized.

example.code:
<summary>
            Notifies when to execute the custom keyboard commands .
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            The following code illustrates how to create a custom command.
            </remarks>
            <example>
            <code lang="Razor">
            <![CDATA[
            <SfDiagramComponent @ref="@diagram" Height="600px" Nodes="@nodes">
            @* Initializing the custom commands*@
                <CommandManager Commands = "@command" Execute="@CommandExecute" CanExecute="@canexe">
                </CommandManager>
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            @code
            {
                // Reference to the diagram
                SfDiagramComponent diagram;
                DiagramObjectCollection<KeyboardCommand> command = new DiagramObjectCollection<KeyboardCommand>()
                {
                    new Command()
                    {
                        Name = "CustomGroup",
                        Gesture = new KeyGesture() { Key = Keys.G, KeyModifiers = KeyModifiers.Control }
                    },
                    new Command()
                    {
                        Name = "CustomUnGroup",
                        Gesture = new KeyGesture() { Key = Keys.U, KeyModifiers = KeyModifiers.Control }
                    },
                };
                // Define the diagram's nodes collection
                DiagramObjectCollection<Node> nodes = new DiagramObjectCollection<Node>();
                public void canexe(CommandKeyArgs args)
                {
                    args.CanExecute = true;
                }
                public void CommandExecute(CommandKeyArgs args)
                {
                    if (args.Gesture.KeyModifiers == KeyModifiers.Control && args.Gesture.Key == Keys.G)
                    {
                        //Custom command to group the selected nodes
                        diagram.Group();
                    }
                    if (args.Gesture.KeyModifiers == KeyModifiers.Control && args.Gesture.Key == Keys.U)
                    {
                        Selector selector = diagram.SelectedItems;
                        //Custom command to ungroup the selected items
                        if (selector.Nodes.Count > 0 && selector.Nodes[0] is Group)
                        {
                            if ((selector.Nodes[0] as Group).Children.Length > 0)
                            {
                                diagram.UnGroup();
                            }
                        }
                    }
                }
            }

member.summary: Represents the appearance of an annotation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Annotation.HorizontalAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal alignment of the text to the parent node/connector.

tr.td: The following options are used to define the Horizontal Alignment of the annotation.
1. Stretch - Stretches the diagram element throughout the node.
2. Left - Aligns the diagram element at the left of the node.
3. Right - Aligns the diagram element at the right of the node.
4. Center - Aligns the diagram element at the center of the node.
5. Auto - Aligns the diagram element based on the characteristics of the node.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Annotation.VerticalAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical alignment of the text to the parent node/connector.

tr.td: The following options are used to define the Vertical Alignment of the annotation.
1. Stretch - Stretches the diagram element throughout the node.
2. Top - Aligns the diagram element at the top of the node.
3. Bottom - Aligns the diagram element at the bottom of the node.
4. Center - Aligns the diagram element at the center of the node.
5. Auto - Aligns the diagram element based on the characteristics of the node.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Node.Ports
member.summary: Gets or sets a collection of PointPort (connection points).
member.remarks: Ports act as the connection points between nodes and allow them to create connections with only those specific points. There may be any number of ports in a node. You can modify the ports' appearance, visibility, positioning and can add custom shapes to them.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Node.Annotations
member.summary: Represents the collection of textual information contained in the node.
member.remarks: The text found in the node can be edited at runtime. Users are able to modify the style, visibility, width, height, and content of the annotation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Node.FixedUserHandles
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of the fixed user handle of the node.
member.remarks: The fixed user handles are used to add some frequently used commands around the node and connector even without selecting it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Node.Pivot
member.summary: Node rotation angle will be based on pivot values which range from 0 to 1 like offset values. By default, the Pivot values are set to X= 0.5 and Y=0.5.
member.remarks:
The below list explains the pivot values.
1. When X= 0 and Y= 0, OffsetX and OffsetY values are considered to be at the top-left corner of the node.
2. When X= 0.5 and Y= 0.5, OffsetX and OffsetY values are considered to be at the nodes center point.
3. When X= 1 and Y= 1, OffsetX and OffsetY values are considered to be at the bottom-right corner of the node.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Node.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the node. If it is not specified, the node renders based on the content's width.
member.remarks: The width of a node does not include borders or margins.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Node.Style
member.summary: Represents the appearance of the node.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Height="600px" Nodes="@nodes" />
             @code
             {
                //Initialize the node collection with node
                DiagramObjectCollection<Node> nodes = new DiagramObjectCollection<Node>();
                protected override void OnInitialized()
                {
                    Node node = new Node()
                    {
                        ID = "node1",
                        //Size of the node
                        Height = 100,
                        Width = 100,
                        //Position of the node
                        OffsetX = 100,
                        OffsetY = 100,
                        //Set the type of shape as flow
                        Style = new ShapeStyle() 
                        {
                            Fill = "#6BA5D7", 
                            StrokeDashArray = "5,5", 
                            StrokeColor = "red", 
                            StrokeWidth = 2 
                        }
                    };
                    nodes.Add(node);
                }
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Node.Shadow
member.summary: Gets or sets the shadow appearance of a node.
member.remarks: The Shadow effect on a node is disabled by default. It can be enabled with the constraint property of the node. The Angle, Distance, and Opacity of the shadow can be customized.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Node.BackgroundColor

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Node.BorderColor

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Node.BorderWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the border width of the node. By default, it is 1px.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Node.Data
member.summary: Returns the record of the data source as data. Each record on the data source represents a node in an automatic layout.
member.remarks: Nodes can be generated automatically with the information provided through the data. This is applicable only while using an automatic layout. You can get the datasource details in a node through the data.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Height="600px" NodeCreating="@OnNodeCreating" ConnectorCreating="@OnConnectorCreating">
                <DataSourceSettings Id = "Id" ParentId="ParentId" DataSource="@DataSource"/>
                    <Layout Type = "LayoutType.MindMap" >
                        < LayoutMargin Top="20" Left="20"/>
                    </Layout>
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            
            @code
            {
                private void OnNodeCreating(IDiagramObject obj)
                {
                    Node node = obj as Node;
                    node.Height = 100;
                    node.Width = 100;
                    node.BackgroundColor = "#6BA5D7";
                    node.Style = new ShapeStyle() { Fill = "#6495ED", StrokeWidth = 1, StrokeColor = "white" };
                    node.Shape = new BasicShape() { Type = Shapes.Basic };
                    MindMapDetails mindmapData = node.Data as MindMapDetails;
                    node.Annotations = new DiagramObjectCollection<ShapeAnnotation>()
                    {
                        new ShapeAnnotation()
                        {
                            Content = mindmapData.Label
                        }
                    };
                }
                private void OnConnectorCreating(IDiagramObject connector)
                {
                    (connector as Connector).Type = ConnectorSegmentType.Orthogonal;
                    (connector as Connector).TargetDecorator.Shape = DecoratorShape.Arrow;
                    (connector as Connector).Style = new ShapeStyle() { StrokeColor = "#6d6d6d" };
                    (connector as Connector).CornerRadius = 5;
                }
                //Business class
                public class MindMapDetails
                {
                    public string Id { get; set; }
                    public string Label { get; set; }
                    public string ParentId { get; set; }
                    public string Branch { get; set; }
                    public string Fill { get; set; }
                }
                public object DataSource = new List<object>()
                {
                    new MindMapDetails() { Id = "1",Label = "Creativity", ParentId = "", Branch = "Root"},
                    new MindMapDetails() { Id = "2",  Label = "Brainstorming", ParentId = "1", Branch = "Right" },
                    new MindMapDetails() { Id = "3",  Label = "Complementing", ParentId = "1", Branch = "Left" },
                };
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Node.Shape
member.summary: Gets or sets the geometrical representation of a node.
member.remarks: The Diagram provides some built-in shapes, such as BasicShape, FlowShape, Path, etc. You can also add custom shapes to the node.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Height="600px" Nodes="@nodes" />
             @code
             {
                //Initialize the node collection with node
                DiagramObjectCollection<Node> nodes = new DiagramObjectCollection<Node>();
                protected override void OnInitialized()
                {
                    Node node = new Node()
                    {
                        ID = "node1",
                        //Size of the node
                        Height = 100,
                        Width = 100,
                        //Position of the node
                        OffsetX = 100,
                        OffsetY = 100,
                        //Set the type of shape as flow
                        Shape = new FlowShape()
                        {
                            Type = Shapes.Flow,
                            Shape = FlowShapesType.DirectData
                        }
                    };
                    nodes.Add(node);
                }
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.NodeGroup
member.summary: Represents a cluster of multiple nodes and connectors into a single element. It acts like a container for its children (nodes, groups, and connectors).

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Height = "500px" @ref="diagram" Nodes="@nodes">
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            @code
            {
                SfDiagramComponent diagram;
                DiagramObjectCollection<Node> nodes = new DiagramObjectCollection<Node>();
                protected override void OnInitialized()
                {
                    Node node1 = createNode("node1", 100, 100);
                    Node node2 = createNode("node2", 300, 100);
                    NodeGroup groupnode = new NodeGroup();
                    // Grouping node 1 and node 2 into a single group
                    groupnode.Children = new string[] { "node1", "node2" };
                    nodes.Add(node1);
                    nodes.Add(node2);
                    nodes.Add(groupnode);
                }
                public Node createNode(string id, double offx, double offy)
                {
                    Node node = new Node()
                    {
                        ID = id,
                        OffsetX = offx,
                        OffsetY = offy,
                        Height = 100,
                        Width = 100,
                        Style = new ShapeStyle() { Fill = "#6495ED" }
                    };
                    return node;
                }
            }
